messages.message:
FWIW, at my last company we experimented with a few different options to see if there were viable Docker Desktop alternatives for Mac similar to what @Cody Boggs described, such as setting up `docker-ce` in Multipass (Ubuntu VM on Mac offering) and other VM options to go with the “Docker in Linux on Mac” type model

We ended up going for the Docker Desktop licenses for Mac in the end because of the level of maintenance/setup overheads for both the Mac Docker users and also those maintaining the bootstrapping tools - things may have changed in the last couple of years to make it easier to maintain though

AFAIK the state of affairs is still about the same sadly. Lol

Alternatives are there, but tedious and a headache. Fortunately crafting makes it a lot easier and more flexible, but for “I need to do dockery things ON my Mac” - docker desktop is the way to go. 

The question then just becomes “but… why not use crafting? :face_with_monocle: “ 
:joy:
